page.title: 04The River Tweed and Fishing
page.content: The{River Tweed}dominates the twelve square km area we surveyed around Kelso. The most common kind of fish in the summer season are{brown trout}and{ {grayling.}Others include{salmon,sea {trout}and{rainbow trout, roach, dace, {minnows, gudgeon}and{sticklebacks.}The River Tweed has a lot of trouble with{poachers}but it has no problems presently with pollution. The river also has had trouble in recent years with a tall plant called {hogweed. This plant spreads rapidly and its juice burns and blisters human skin. { {Kelso Angling club}has over 300 members: adults pay Â£5.00 to join but boys under 13 are free. At{the {junction,}where the Teviot joins the Tweed, it costs Â£200 a week. There are many birds coming back to the Tweed including {dippers, kingfishers, {herons, gooseanders }and {cormorants.
